Build id: I20070110-1600

Steps to reproduce:

1) Paste this stack trace into Java stack trace console:

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=57826&action=view

2) Ctrl+A, Ctrl+Shift+F to format the stack
3) In the view, position i-beam at the start of a line
4) Hold down shift, and hit down arrow a few times to select a line
5) Hit Delete.

The presentation is now screwed up.  The deleted line is replaced with the line from below, but all the other lines don't move up.  It looks like it's not correctly detecting the damaged region, and most of the view isn't being repainted.  Scrolling the view, or min/maximize the view, will force a repaint and then it looks fine.

When in this state I also get lots of errors in the log. They seem to be of two varieties:
